Identification.Uses advised against: Food, drug, pesticide or biocidal product use.

Hazard Identification.Classification: This chemical is considered hazardous by the 2012 OSHA Hazard Communication Standard (29 CFR 1910.1200)
Hazard Identification.Hazard Statements: May form combustible dust concentrations in air

Precautionary Statements.Prevention:
Wash face, hands and any exposed skin thoroughly after handling
Wear eye/face protection
Precautionary Statements.Eyes: IF IN EYES: Rinse cautiously with water for several minutes. Remove contact lenses, if present and easy to do. Continue rinsing

First Aid Measures.General Advice: If symptoms persist, call a physician.
First Aid Measures.Eye Contact: Rinse immediately with plenty of water, also under the eyelids, for at least 15 minutes. Get
First Aid Measures.Skin Contact: Wash off immediately with plenty of water for at least 15 minutes. If skin irritation persists,
First Aid Measures.Inhalation: Remove to fresh air. If not breathing, give artificial respiration. Get medical attention if
First Aid Measures.Ingestion: Clean mouth with water and drink afterwards plenty of water. Get medical attention if

Handling and Storage.Storage: Store in a well-ventilated place. Keep container tightly closed

Exposure Controls.Engineering Measures: Ensure that eyewash stations and safety showers are close to the workstation location.
Exposure Controls.Eye/face Protection: Wear appropriate protective eyeglasses or chemical safety goggles as described by
Exposure Controls.Respiratory Protection: Follow the OSHA respirator regulations found in 29 CFR 1910.134 or European Standard
